page.title: 11PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: The River Wharfe flows through the Wharfe valley, and is surrounded by a flood plain. North of the river is Weston park, a large wooded area, and a part of Otley, called Newall. South of the river is another part of Otley called Westbourne. West of Otley is another town called Burley. The highest point of the land is Beacon Hill which is 232 metres high. It is situated on the West Chevin, a hill South of Otley. The main roads in the area are, the A660 from Otley to Burley and the A65, which runs from Burley, going South East towards Menston. Another main road is the A6039, going North East from Menston to Otley.The is good farmland and there are about 19 farms in the area. There is now one railway in the area as the Otley station was closed down in the sixties.
